context: Secret Ending: The Beginning — Under 120 hours, all high relationships, selfless choices, beat Ghost with every car type. The credits reverse. Time loops. The Ghost was always there.

lines.text: Credits roll.
Names scroll upward in white text on black. The team. The voices. The music. Everything that made this possible, reduced to a list moving at a readable pace.
Normal. Expected. The part where you put the controller down.
The music plays. Something gentle. A piano and a synth doing something melancholy that sounds like looking out a window on a Sunday.
The credits reach the end. 'Thank you for playing.' A period. A finality.
Black screen.
One second. Two. Three.
Then the credits start moving backward.
Slowly at first. Like a VHS rewinding. The names scroll down. The music warps — notes stretching, bending, running in reverse like water flowing uphill.
Faster now. The text blurs. The music collapses into a single sustained tone that drops in pitch. Lower. Lower.
Everything is rewinding. Not just the credits. Everything.
Flashes. Reversed. The final race running backward. Cars un-crashing. Tires un-squealing. Champagne flying upward back into bottles.
Act 4 unraveling. Act 3. The Fall un-falling. Act 2. The Rise un-rising.
Faster. Faster.
Relationships reversing. Conversations un-spoken. Handshakes un-shaken. That first look from Maya, unseen.
The whole story, unwinding like a spool of film pulled from the projector.
And then—
SMASH CUT.
Rain.
A CRX. Wipers barely keeping up. The kind of rain that turns the world into a watercolor.
A red light. The only color in a grey world. Bleeding through the rain like a wound.
Your hands on the wheel. Cracked phone in the cupholder. Screen showing a notification you don't want to read. Eviction notice. Final. No more extensions. No more chances.
The beginning. Your beginning. The exact moment where everything started.
A GT-R pulls up in the next lane. Rain beading on matte black paint. Engine note like a threat wrapped in a promise. The driver revs. Once. Looking straight ahead.
The light turns green.
But this time — something is different.
In the rearview mirror.
Another car. Far behind. Half a block. Maybe more. Hard to tell through the rain.
No headlights.
Just sitting there. Idling. Watching.
You didn't notice it before. The first time. You were too focused on the GT-R. Too focused on the eviction notice. Too focused on surviving.
But now you see it.
THE GHOST was always there.

From the very beginning. Every race. Every choice. Every midnight run and every dawn return. A car with no headlights, watching from the distance. Never interfering. Never helping. Just... witnessing.
Waiting for you to become what you were always going to become.
The GT-R launches. Tires screaming through rain. The challenge. The beginning.
Your hands tighten on the wheel. The CRX shakes with barely-contained potential. The eviction notice glows in the dark.
In the mirror, the Ghost doesn't move. Doesn't follow. Doesn't need to.
It already knows how this ends.
It already knows how this begins.
You drop the clutch.
MIDNIGHT GRIND
Again.
